threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered unknown. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects the presence of a number of Windows API functionality often seen within embedded executables. When this signature alerts on an executable, it is not an indication of malicious behavior. However, if seen firing in other file types, deeper investigation may be warranted.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DotNET CLR Usage Log Artifact
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of Usage Log files by the CLR (clr.dll). These files are named after the executing process once the assembly is finished executing for the first time in the (user) session context.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe" --service; CommandLine="powershell.exe" -NoLogo -NonInteractive -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command -; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

match_context.values: @{Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Hashes=SHA1=0C01E942244F1ED095D5EC92DA2FA043565C5CDD,MD5=D3C21CD0C70DC36FDD8A61E4517A226D,SHA256=D7A94CE4C50764B8A6F67DB308F8609AC38F08D1113079EAF81A25AB44E72BA6,IMPHASH=13C7ACE23F99CD5FBC3ABD5C16BF2DCE; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe" --service; CommandLine="msiexec" /i C:\ProgramData\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\Updates\PDQConnectUpdater-0.3.0.msi /quiet /qn /norestart /L*V C:\ProgramData\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\Updates\updater_install.log; FileVersion=5.0.17134.228 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Unsigned DLL Loaded by Windows Utility
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects windows utilities loading an unsigned or untrusted DLL.
Adversaries often abuse those programs to proxy execution of malicious code.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=984DC5485954A1E217C74674869986E567746890,MD5=FB0DCCBA21CB4DD891D815FA9C3531F3,SHA256=D50332E27756D8D5B4E6F7D3C54E1F0D22D0F1BF38522ABA87EE2D77D0980CB3,IMPHASH=3D39C72FCD0660E4867A1E837A1D5C88; Product=WixSharp; OriginalFileName=WixSharp.dll; ImageLoaded=C:\Windows\Installer\MSIB7F2.tmp; Description=WixSharp; SignatureStatus=Unavailable; EventID=7; FileVersion=2.1.5.0; Signed=false; Image=C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe; Company=Oleg Shilo}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) trying to install MSI packages with SYSTEM privilege

match_context.values: @{Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Hashes=SHA1=0C01E942244F1ED095D5EC92DA2FA043565C5CDD,MD5=D3C21CD0C70DC36FDD8A61E4517A226D,SHA256=D7A94CE4C50764B8A6F67DB308F8609AC38F08D1113079EAF81A25AB44E72BA6,IMPHASH=13C7ACE23F99CD5FBC3ABD5C16BF2DCE; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe" --service; CommandLine="msiexec" /i C:\ProgramData\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\Updates\PDQConnectUpdater-0.3.0.msi /quiet /qn /norestart /L*V C:\ProgramData\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\Updates\updater_install.log; FileVersion=5.0.17134.228 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe" --service; CommandLine="powershell.exe" -NoLogo -NonInteractive -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command -; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Program Files\PDQ\PDQConnectAgent\pdq-connect-agent.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Using Alias Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Set-Alias or New-Alias cmdlet usage. Which can be use as a mean to obfuscate PowerShell scripts

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name gcim -Value Get-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=e64d587f-fd18-4f82-bb4b-03df7846f4c5; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name scim -Value Set-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=82f88b9b-0f5a-40ca-b0b4-5d797184fec4; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name ncim -Value New-CimInstance  -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=b196290a-4555-414f-8b92-5a79d0398df5; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name rcim -Value Remove-cimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=88a71a17-82c9-40ba-b4f0-ca1c015d1d6d; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name icim -Value Invoke-CimMethod -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=b9ef277e-b72a-4f6a-97cb-47607a564f3e; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}
